com.irit.smac.model

Class Relation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.irit.smac.model.Relation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Relation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Relation: This class models a relation between two agents. It possesses a type (used to determine its ui.class) and a list of Attributes.
    Since:
    29/03/2017
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nicolas Verstaevel - nicolas.verstaevel@irit.fr
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Relation

        public Relation(Entity a,
                Entity b,
                java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String type,
                boolean directional,
                Snapshot s)
        Creates a new Relation between two agents A and B.
        Parameters:
        a - The reference to the agent A.
        b - The reference to the agent B.
        name - The name of the relation (must be unique)
        type - The type of the relation (used to determine its ui.class).
        directional - True if the relation is directional (A to B) false if it is bidirectional (A--B).
        s - The reference to the snapshot the relation belongs to.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(Relation obj)
        Compares two relations to determine if they are equals (R1.A==R1.A and R1.B==R2.B and R1.isDirectional==R2.isDirectional)
        Parameters:
        obj - The relation to be compared with.
        Returns:
        True if they are equals, false otherwise.
